Define class FileChecking with attribute(s) and method(s). Operations with configuration files. It defines:

attributes:
__slots__ - Setting class slots
VERBOSE - Console text indicator for current process-phase
__MODES - Mode file operations
__file_path_ok - File path exist
__file_extension_ok - File extension is expected
__file_mode_ok - Supported file mode
methods:
__init__ - Initial constructor
check_file - Check configuration file path
check_format - Check configuration file format by extension
check_mode - Checking operation mode for configuration file
is_file_ok - final status of configuration file
VERBOSE = 'ATS_UTILITIES::CONFIG::FILE_CHECKING'¶

Check configuration file path.

Parameters:
  • file_path (<str>) – Absolute configuration file path
  • verbose (<bool>) – Enable/disable verbose option
Returns:

True (exist and regular file) | False
Return type:

<bool>
Exceptions:

ATSBadCallError | ATSTypeError

  • verbose (<bool>) – Enable/disable verbose option

<bool>

Checking operation mode for configuration file.

Parameters:
  • file_mode (<str>) – File mode (‘r’, ‘w’, ‘a’, ‘b’, ‘x’, ‘t’, ‘+’)
  • verbose (<bool>) – Enable/disable verbose option
Returns:

True (regular file mode) | False
Return type:

<bool>

ATSBadCallError | ATSTypeError
is_file_ok()[source]¶

Return final status of configuration file.

Returns:Boolean value (correct file) True, else False
Return type:<bool>
Exceptions:None

Module contents¶

Configuration file can contain configuration in next formats:
XML - Configuration described by Extensible Markup Language.
INI - Configuration described by basic structure composed of sections, properties, and values.
CFG - Configuration described by keys and values.
YAML - Configuration described by basic structure composed of sections, properties, and values.
JSON - Configuration described by basic structure composed of sections, properties, and values.
